intro: Oreobroma leeanum, commonly known as the Florida rocknettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as scrublands and pine flatwoods. Oreobroma leeanum is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, subtropical climate of its native range.
